intro: Actephila flavescens, commonly known as the yellow-flowered actephila, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia, particularly China and Japan. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, clustered yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Actephila flavescens is often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream sides.
